The International Kiwanis Motto is "Serving the Children of the World."  The Chandler Young Professionals Club members hold this motto close to their hearts.  Our club was created with the busy schedule of the working professional in mind.   We are "BUSY" professionals who are young at heart.  The age of our members range between the 20's to the 70's.  Instead of meeting weekly for breakfast or lunch we only meet twice a month.  We annually fund dozens of worthwhile projects, dedicated to improving the quality of life of our community's less fortunate children.

WHAT IS KIDS AT HOPE?Kids at Hope is not another program; it is first and foremost a belief system, supported by a cultural strategy and then enhanced by programs.INSPIRESAn innovative concept which states and demonstrates that all children are capable of success, NO EXCEPTIONS!EMPOWERSKids at Hope empowers organizations to transform their cultures through professional, personal and volunteer development workshops, seminars, institutes and classes.TRANSFORMSDemonstrates how an entire organization, school and/or community can support the success of all children, NO EXCEPTIONS!

recommendations: November 2, 2014, CHANTAL reported directly to Charles

As a Department Chair at Primavera Online High School I reported directly to Mr. Charles Anthony.  His drive, enthusiasm and dedication for his work are evident. He was great at encouraging his staff to share their ideas, voice their concerns and he  trusted their judgment. He had a very full plate but still made time for his employees to check in and set goals.  He was able to delegate wisely and recognize our accomplishments. It was an absolute pleasure to work for him!Chantal GilmoreStaffing ManagerKey Resource Group

Chantal is a genuine and wonderful person and leader! She was the electives department chair for Primavera Online High School where I served as her administrator. Any organization looking to raise the bar and positively influence their climate and culture will be well served by her talent and ability.

summary: Experienced Educator with a demonstrated history of working and leading in the field of education. Author and writer focusing on international fiction and the  Cuban experience. Skilled in Nonprofit Organizations, Analytical Skills, Coaching, Conflict Resolution, and Educational Technology. Strong mediator and communication professional with a Doctor of Education (Ed.D.) focused in Educational Leadership and Administration, Masters in leadership from Grand Canyon University and Northern Arizona University.
name: Charles Anthony Ed.D
title: Clinical Assistant Professor Arizona State University/Author
